column4: I'm trying to move all .swp files from a directory and all the swp files in its children & so forth directories as well. How cal I select them all?
so I dont' have to do mv ./*.swp ./temp && mv ./*/*.swp ./temp && mv ./*/*/*.swp ./temp && etc...
you would have to use find or a shell script
do you mean you need to delete them?  once moved they don't work
and once removed it is possible for a file being edited to be corrupted
is you are talking to me use my nick in your response
what is the best way to properly dispose of them?/
I have many of them from vim sessions. Not sure why they remain

.swp files exist while a file is being edited by vi - they disappear when the session ends - if a .swp exists it means either the file is still being edited of the vi session was discontinued abruptly (system rebooted during edit, for example) so why do you want to remove them, what's going on?
well I do have my session open. I uploaded the dirs to anothe server
and it seems the files are getting corrupted. the last 5-10 lines are replicating at the bottom. doing PHP work so this is causing allm y files to err heh
should I close vim and then reupload those directories?
i do not know what you mean by 'upload directories'
you want to close your vim session before moving the directories around else the .swp files will go too, and then when you vi on the server you have an exiting .swp file and vi gets confused
where vim puts the .swp files is configurable i believe, you could cause them to be created outside your workspace
if I save my vim session does it persist the .swp files?
.swp files are removed when the session is closed
the existence of a .swp file usually means either the file is being edited or the session terminated abnormally (hence the file needs to be recovered)
i can't tell you what you should do with them but i can explain how they work so you can make appropriate decision whether to delete them
i will tell you not to run that find command unless you know what you're doing - deleting .swp files while the file is being edited may trash your file
either close your vim sessions or package up everything but the .swp files to move
better to close your vims
